channel.title: CVE Feed for F5 -- BIG-IP AFM
channel.description: The latest CVEs for F5 -- BIG-IP AFM

item.title: CVE-2022-28695|2024-09-17T02:31:19.942Z -- f5 -- big-ip%20afm
item.description: On F5 BIG-IP AFM 16.1.x versions prior to 16.1.2.2, 15.1.x versions prior to 15.1.5.1, 14.1.x versions prior to 14.1.4.6, and 13.1.x versions prior to 13.1.5, an authenticated attacker with high privileges can upload a maliciously crafted file to the BIG-IP AFM Configuration utility, which allows an attacker to run arbitrary commands. Note: Software versions which have reached End of Technical Support (EoTS) are not evaluated

item.title: CVE-2022-41806|2024-09-17T03:39:00.083Z -- f5 -- big-ip%20afm
item.description: In versions 16.1.x before 16.1.3.2 and 15.1.x before 15.1.5.1, when BIG-IP AFM Network Address Translation policy with IPv6/IPv4 translation rules is configured on a virtual server, undisclosed requests can cause an increase in memory resource utilization.
